Subject: Your vs. You're - Which One is Right?

Dear [Recipient's Name],

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to reach out to you regarding a common mistake that many people make when using the words "you're" and "your."

"You're" is a contraction of "you are," while "your" is a possessive adjective used to describe something belonging to you.
